page.title: 09FARMING..CROP IRRIGATION
page.content: Mr.John Lang of Hilton of Carslogie has invested heavily to drill 3 boreholes to supply irrigation water to all parts of his land.The three wells are each 220 feet deep and in total they produce up to 240 gallons each minute.The water comes from a deep layer of white sandstone which has excellent water retention properties.The boreholes are 8 inches wide and are unlined.Each borehole costs about Â£2,500, and in addition there is the cost of supplying a piping system to relay water to all fields.The well water comes to the surface at a temperature of around 4 degrees Celcius which is a bit cold as it can chill crops and soil. However, the advantages are considerable and outweigh other factors.
